values:
So, is this how I'm gonna spend the rest of my December breaks, for at least the next few years? If yes, I'm doomed.

Posted via LiveJournal.app.

"Realize that men are NOT monogamous. Yes, I know that isn't what you want to hear. But consider this, if you realize this up front, you're already way ahead of the game! Thus, your goal shouldn't be to get your guy to commit and be monogamous to you - it should be to become the woman for whom he WANTS to be monogamous! Do you get the difference here?"

Was reading an article about commitment. The above paragraph struck me. Indeed, there is a difference. 

A very critical one at that.

Your friends won't run away just because you don't meet them often. 

If they do, they probably ain't friends to begin with; just companions.

To most, I'm someone of a relatively mild temperament (although my folks will beg to differ). Hardly will I be seen losing my cool. I may whine, I may complain, but I will try my best not to lose it, even if it means I have to shut up and just smile to EQ-less people. Simply because it's not worth it, most of the time.

So if you still manage to piss me off, you must have been a real pain.

I had a good chat with a friend. Thanks for spending a couple of hours of your Friday afternoon with me while your husband and daughter is waiting at home for you. 

She helped me to summarise my thoughts and weighed my opportunity costs. I am grateful for someone who is willing to listen to me and help me analyse my situation objectively. I finally arrived at a decision and I will stick to it. With every decision, there will be repercussions to face and I guess I just have to suck it up and move on.  

At the end of our session, I thanked her again and she said, "Don't worry, you're my friend." That really warmed me. 

FInally, I will no longer be sitting on the fence nor pacing back and forth. Instead, Im feeling free, and relieved.

I haven't sang since 2Dawn was sold. 

Which means, I haven't sang this year! Goodness. 

Been itching lately; hopefully will get to sing tonight!

I was looking back at how life had been for me since I left school in 2004. 

Many things happened after 2004 till now, a good 6 years. Some of which happened in such a whirlwind that frankly, if you ask me now, I won't be able to remember or will take eternity to recall. 

There was even a point in time where I was holding a full time job, with 2 tuitions, learning Class 2B and Class 3 consecutively, clubbing 4 times a week, sleeping at 4am and waking up at 7am on weekdays, altogether with a less-than-mature boyfriend. 

Just one of the examples of my mad lifestyles back then.

When I think back at that time, I really wondered how did I even manage that. I feel exhausted just thinking about it now. However back then, I don't remember feeling tired or unmanageable. 

I derailed a little along the way. Alot of things happened and happened very quickly. I wasn't doing what my peers were doing. In a way, I was forced to grow up faster than most people of my age. 

Now when I look back, I finally realise what it means when people say "Everything happens for a reason." There was a reason why I went off-track. I am actually glad that it happened. If not, I wouldn't be who I am today. 

My life now is more or less more stable, and I am able to look forward and tell you what is going to happen to me for the next 5years. I may have taken a longer route as compared to others, but it is this longer route that taught me many things that I might otherwise not been able to learn. 

The many important people in my life now are also people whom I met along this alternative route. For this alone I can't be thankful enough. My life would have been entirely different now if I went the way I was supposed to go. Better or worse, I would never know. 

All I know is that I am happy and contented with the way I am right now and I am glad that I am finally back on track and heading somewhere.

Selvei asked me the other day, 'Ain't you sad that you can't take milk?'

I replied instantly, 'It's ok, I believe I will be blessed in other areas.'

I am very blessed because of the people that I have in my life. So, I would like take some time and thank these people. 

1) My family. My parents and 3 siblings. I believe they are the greatest gift that I can ever ask for. Thank you for giving me sucha wonderful home that many can only dream about.

2) My friends. Including my colleagues who are not just my colleagues. I am not someone with alot of friends, but I am contented with the little close knitted group that I have. You know who you are. My life is filled with so much more laughter and joy because of you. For that I am thankful. Thank you for being sucha great friend. And most of all, a true friend. That is all I will ever ask of you. 

3) Vinz. Thank you for loving me despite my many flaws and for never asking anything of me in return. I am thankful for your presence in my life for the past 2 years, and for the many more years to come. 

For everything else that I don't have, I believe it's not meant to be mine in the first place so why look so hard in the other direction when all I need is already right infront of my eyes? =)

Always been taught to never give up, no matter what.

And the naivete in me actually managed to convince myself for so long that there may be this really slight glimmer of hope somewhere, somehow.

For the first time, giving up is an option harder than hanging on. 

But I will still do it anyways.

I chanced upon a blog, where a girl was talking about her birthday wishlist.

In it, it included:

1) LV
2) Hermes
3) Loewe
4) iPhone

And she's like, what, 21?

Either she's got super rich parents who spoil her rotten, or she has a boyfriend who will pluck the stars for her.

Kids nowadays.

We all stumble at times; we may even fall. 

It could be because we weren't careful and tripped over ourselves; or that someone left a banana skin there. 

Whatever it is, the reason of the fall is no longer important; the reason to stand up is much more. 

So, just suck it up and move on! 

=)

So, I'm back to that whirlpool and rushing around like some mad person everyday. This has got to be the busiest time of the year for my job, and it doesn't help knowing that Ive got added duties which equates to additional hours burnt. :( 

In spite of all these, I am glad that I have wonderful people to work with and it makes a whole load of difference. It makes everything less painful and everyday easier. I would have crumbled under pressure long time ago if not for these angels around me who encouraged me along the way, lent me a listening ear when I needed one and dished out super useful advises for me the newbie. 

There may be people who doesn't see the need to build a good rapport with their colleagues and thus keep to themselves most of the time / doesn't bother to mix around. However, I see it as an important energy to fuel me and keep me going. Especially in my environment, where people are highly stressed, it really does wonders to oneself, to just take some time to laugh at a joke. 

My seriousness shall be contained in other professional areas. Other than that, I am really a nut case at work. It makes my life easier by laughing it off.

Yes, I refuse to give up my naivete. 

And most of the time I don't get burned. 

But this year I really did. 

I am now tightening the reins on my love and trust. 

"Trust, but verify."

A friend posted this on his FB status: "true friends side with their friends all the time no matter what... how true..." I would like to think that, this statement holds true if the following conditions are satisfied: 1) The situation you are in is not of your fault. 2) The decision you are making is not something that is wrong / unacceptable by normal social standards. 3) You have been entirely truthful so that your friend is able to assess the situation in the clearest possible manner. 4) You have been a true friend to those in question as well. Also, your definition of "no matter what" is crucial too. Is it really, no matter what? Even if its against your friend's conscience? Even if your friends knows what you are doing ain't right? Even if your friends have previously expressed opposing views? It is such an irony, really.

...you're asking me to feel the things you never show?

It's weird. The power of words. Mere words.

Talk is cheap. 

And, I'm expected to believe?

You don't know how ridiculous you sound.

If my life can stop at this very moment, I will die very happy.

The peace, the tranquility, I like how I can totally be myself and be oblivious to my surroundings. 

I like talking to myself.

I like listening to myself. 

I like being with myself.

Hint of narcissism? Nah, it's just about finding that inner balance and be totally comfortable with oneself. The interaction from within.

Go on, try it.

I think, it's time.

Been going through several sites for layout inspirations, sadly none inspired me. Think it will be awhile more before I see something that triggers off something in me. 

Also, am contemplating making this place private. One of the reasons why I don't update much is because of the fact that this is a public place. I think i need to tweak some privacy settings so that I can utilise this space more frequently. I like how wordpress has this little password-protected option for selected entries. Seems like LJ doesn't have this feature. Hmmm.

Time to jumpship?

"Women, take note: The initially shy or awkward guys usually make better husbands in the long run than the instantly suave, charismatic ones!"

Above quote taken from yet another Yahoo! featured article. I can't say that it is absolutely true for Im not married yet, but that is what I believe as well (and hopefully it will be true!).

I know how attractive are those guys who are good with their words and can keep a girl entertained in a conversation. But somehow a small part of me will always remind myself that if he can do this with me almost instantly, means he can easily do that with other girls also. So that leaves no guessing as to how assuring can he be if he were to be a partner.

Im not saying to take that as a sure sign when assessing someone but it could be a subtle sign of how a guy generally is with others as well. Of course there will be many other factors to be taken into consideration, this is just one out of many to be considered.

I was reading Mr Brown's blog (www.mrbrown.com) on an entry about an emotional ceremony, which is that of his 2nd child's graduation from kindergarten. That said, it should be his 2nd time attending his kids' kindergarten graduation so what's there to be so emo about? He quickly read his readers' thoughts (which explains why he's one of the top bloggers in Singapore) and carried on to explain: "I know what you are thinking. What about Faith, our eight-year-old? Ah, our Faith had her own special graduation at her Special School. Being autistic, she never went to a regular kindergarten and never will. Her graduation was special too, don't get me wrong. But my wife and I only saw a regular kindergarten graduation with our second-born. It took us eight years to see this, so it was very moving for us." This paragraph struck me hard. Here he is, a national blogger with god-knows-how-many viewers on his blog everyday, telling everyone that his daughter is autistic. Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with being autistic. Coming from the education line I have seen many of these cases so its nothing that Im unfamiliar with. That said, I actually looking up to him for being willing to recognise the issue and take up the most feasible solution, i.e his Faith is autistic therefore he sends her to a special school where she can receive the most suitable form of education from teachers who are specially trained to look into their needs, as well as tailor-made curriculum that will ensure that they actually learn something. Those of you who are not parents, will certainly say "Isn't that supposed to be the way to handle this?" As we all know, love is selfish and as parents, we will only want the best for our child. To some, being in a Special School seems to be a "label" which they are highly reluctant to let their kids carry. To others, they believe that their kid's condition will not improve if they do not mix with other "normal" kids. This may be true if your child's condition is mild (as diagnosed by the doctors) but if it is not, I believe we should look into what is the best environment for the child instead. Afterall, a school is a place for us to learn, and that should be the goal for us if we want our child to receive education, that they actually do learn something. No? This reminds me of a similar experience I had when I was younger. Not that I was autistic, but most of you would have known that I am a leftie. I had a seriously hard time when I was young, especially during my formative years when I was just learning to write. Noone in my house is a leftie, and thus you can imagine how difficult a time my mum had trying to teach me to write. She resorted to forcing me to write with my right hand after hearing from others that it can actually be trained. So everyday, she will hold my right hand in an attempt to teach me to write but I will cry and cry because I just cannot write with my right hand. She will teach me the first few letters in the penmanship and I will be left on my own to finish the rest, which I, of course, quickly switched to my left hand to finish it before she comes back to check on me. After sometime, she realised that it was too tiring and frustrating for both of us and thus she gave up trying to make me write with my right hand. However, she continued to train me to use my right hand in every other thing and that is why nowadays if you have not seen me write before, you will never know that I am actually a leftie. As long as I can write, does it really matter which hand did I write with? Why force me to adapt to the world of righties, which I obviously didnt belong to? In the end, it left us both tired and frustrated. Same with the teachers in mainstream schools and the children with special needs. My point is, parents should look into the interests of the child first and foremost, when it comes to choosing the type of education for kids with special needs. We all send our child to school hoping that they learn something. If they end up not learning because of the unsuitable environment, then it defeats the purpose of sending them to a school in the first place. I believe they will be happier in a place where they do not feel out of place and where they can learn according to their needs. I am not complaining whatsoever, but just that seeing some of these kids everyday makes my heart ache, because it seems like they have been denied the kind treatment that they rightfully deserve. They are right infront of me, and yet I can't do anything to help them. And I hate being so helpless.

There are 2 kind of friends:

1) Those who sponteneously asks for meetups most of the time and make constant contact with others.

2) Those who seldom initiate contact of any kind.

I lean more towards Type 2. I don't have alot of friends, but I am glad for that few close ones that I have. Some people feel more alive being surrounded by friends constantly; others feel contented with the occasional meetups ie. once in a couple of months. I belong to the latter. 

Having said that, there are bound to be friends who hate me for supposedly not putting in effort to maintain a friendship. 'Cause I hardly ask for meetup or msn/sms people to find out how have their life been. I am more passive in this aspect. 

However, it doesnt mean that I don't care. I have just decided to love myself more by spending more time with myself. I have stopped going out during weekdays unless neccesary. Maybe its an age thing, but I do feel the need to spend time doing some reflections/soul searching. Or simply, to rest. I no longer have the energy to go clubbing 4 days a week (yes at one point of time I was doing that), or having dinners out everyday of the week. 

To me, I feel that if the love is there, it will be, regardless of the amount of meetups. There are times when I meet someone for only a few times a year, but everytime that we do, we have loads of fun and it seems like we have never left each other's life. I really cherish such bonds and the faith in knowing that we are not forgetten. 

It really boils down to individual belief and faith in keeping things going. If one has got no faith, no amount of meetups will ease your doubts. However if you have the courage to believe, you will know that there are friends who will never leave you and will be there when you need them.

Cheers to all my friends; I really still do care about you, very much.

I don't know about you, but Yahoo! has been my homepage ever since I started using the Internet. I love how it is full of information, latest gossips or hoo-haas right in your face the moment you click on your little blue "e". On the other hand, Google webpage is bare and to me it doesn't value add at all. Recently, I came across an interesting article on Yahoo which was chosen as one of their feature: Dating Advice: 10 Annoying Text Habits to Avoid. Though its under the category of Dating, I feel that this is applicable to everyone. Here's the link: http://dating.personals.yahoo.com/singles/datingtips/88456/dating-advice-10-annoying-text-habits-to-avoid It's quite a long article so Im not gonna paste the whole article here. Here are snippets of the parts that I particularly like- "You know for a fact that this very same text just went out to 20 other people at exactly the same time, and that the sender is just waiting to receive all his/her options before deciding what to do. So what if the only thing you have planned for the night is that lame (but sooo good) Lifetime movie at 11? You refuse to hang out with someone unless they make specific plans to hang out with you. " "One person pulls out her iPhone while everyone else is looking at the dinner bill, and then someone else starts doing it, and before you know it, you're in the middle of the sacred circle of text. Resist the urge to choose some random person in your contacts to send a useless message to. " "We're huge advocates of love and being in love and enjoying that love. People gushing on and on about their amazing love life? Not so much. Not only do you have to listen to them tell every insignificant story about how cute it was that their boyfriends ate pancakes for dinner and woke up with a funny hairdo, but you also have to read all of their SUPER-cute texts. " Do take some time to read this and find out if you've been committing any of those. I find most of them very true in this day and age where mobiles have become a necessity to almost everyone. I myself have passed the stage of incessant SMS-ing as I was looking at my bill the other day; I only managed to chalk up barely 300 smses in a month. You may even take these as tips to lower the amount of smses you use up a month, or as a way not to bust the amount of free smses allocated. Enjoy.

Sometimes, not everything has an explantion. Coincidences is one of them. Not everything needs an explantion either, so don't be too hard on yourself to find out the "truth" of everything. This afternoon, I started my iTunes and was kinda bored listening to the same old songs playing in the playlist that I created for my iPhone. I went over to the search button and suddenly had a feeling of listening to something "lounge-y" and thus decided to retrieve my Zero 7 album. Jing intro-ed me one of the songs, Give It Away , which I had an immediate attraction to and proceeded to get the whole album for myself. 2nd to Give It Away is this song called Destiny: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=INn1C6ImJKg Alrights please do enjoy the song for now, I will continue on this entry hopefully tomorrow (later today). =)

For everything that I have, I lose some.
For everything that I dont have, I have others.

- Others which are just as good, if not better. 

Recently I pondered upon the issues of equality in life. Not talking about Women's Rights or something here, but more on the things that we have/do not have in life. 

Long time ago, I heard this phrase "Life is a trade-off." and I can't help but to agree with it almost wholeheartedly. There are people who think that they have everything, and there are also people who think that they have nothing. Truth is, everybody has something and nobody has everything. I have learnt to come to terms with this since some time ago as my experiences in life have proven to me as well. 

Subconsciously, there are times where I can't help but to be envious at other people. Not saying that it is wrong to be envious, it may even be a source of motivation to some, to strive to achieve what they havn't already got. But there are certainly things that cannot be attained by monetary terms, no matter how hard you try. An intact family, an understanding and supportive partner/spouse, friends who stick to you through thick and thin, all these are what many people strive to attain but not all succeed. 

This is why I resort to fate, as the ultimate happiness in life is not measured by the amount of money you have, but the amount of things that you have which can't be bought with money. Fate and destiny decide the kind of family we are born in and the people whom we meet through the course of our lives. Therefore I somewhat believe that our happiness is "fixed" and its up to us how to make the best out of what we have.

Everytime I get envious of others, I've learnt to turn my thoughts into counting the blessings that I have instead. It is very easy to fall into the dark side i.e. getting envious of others, being pessimistic and then worse still, developing inferiority oomplex and insecurities. It is really important to remind yourself to look on the other side of the coin instead. 

Since there is no way we can have everything that is there to have, so why smile at what we have instead? =)

Boarded 157 which heads to BoonLay from my place on the way back to Hall just now. As always, Im delighted to see that the bus is a single deck one as I always have the impression that single deck buses move faster. (correct me if I am wrong). However, when I boarded the bus, I was surprised as these seats greeted me: I suppose this is an attempt for commuters to "travel in style". The coolness factor is there definitely, but I feel it stops there. Firstly, all the seats were sideways (perpendicular to the forward-moving motion of the bus) and secondly, there were considerably lesser seats than a normal everyday bus. For myself, I am someone who cannot sit backwards against the forward moving motion of the bus. Therefore when I boarded, and facing the whole aisle of sideway seats, the immediate thought of "oh darn how am I supposed to survive this 1 hour ride." immediately came to my mind. I sat on one of the end seats as depicted in the 1st picture. And if you were wondering, yes I did survive this 1hr bus ride with no major headache whatsoever. I even enjoyed the ample leg space. =) It was close to 10pm when I boarded this bus, therefore I feel SBS only use these buses during off-peak hours where there will be a lesser crowd. I foresee if these were to be used during peak hours, commuters will definitely complain about the lack of seats in these buses. This is actually not the first time I came across such buses, the first time was last year, or the year before, on a 153. Can't remember if I blogged about it but I did take pictures as well. (But they are on the laptop at home). Will post them up when I get home next monday after my last paper. I am not sure how these "themed-concept" buses came about but the advertisements I saw in the buses were that of some music thingy from Nokia. The one i saw on 153 was some beer company. Heineken, if I am not wrong. Both buses were trying to replicate the interior of a pub/club/chillout place and is definitely a refreshing experience for commuters. It will be nice to board one of these buses some days but I will still opt for our traditional concept buses with front facing seats especially for long journey rides. Call me old-fashioned but yea, comfort is above all for me. =)

Somehow, i always feel like i am waiting for something to come/happen. I don't know what am i exactly waiting for nor why am i waiting, but i just feel this way somehow. Its like.. i wait for 745am to come every monday to wake up for school, i wait for 230pm to come every thursday to head home after the week in school.. that sort of waiting. I dont know, its kinda like im waiting to time to come and i will go through the motion of things again. This is probably due to my life being too mundane i guess. Probably its an age thingy, where one no longer gets excited nor look forward to things easily. Time come and go, so does people. One day has passed, and soon, this semester will be over in 23 days. I feel that i am becoming ridiculously unmotivated. Seems like nothing can push me anymore now. I am just waiting for november 17th to come when i have my last paper, waiting for december holidays where i can slack my ass off, waiting for end of feb to go on my practicum, waiting for work plan seminar's announcement in march to see whether anything good comes out of it.. and more waiting. no anticipation, just waiting. you get what i mean now? ************************************** Was thinking about what i want to do for the rest of my life. One thing i am pretty certain is i will be staying in the education sector. Whether it will be with MOE or not, that i am not too sure. There are many other paths i can take beside slogging away under the local education system. There are the international schools, private schools, tuition-assessment related industry, schools overseas and more. Many choices are open for me, i guess the main factor will be whether i would want to give up being a civil servant with an iron rice bowl and venture into the private sector or not. What happens after my bond ends, nobody knows. Talk so much now, maybe by then im a tai tai and don't even have to work anymore. Yea. Dream on.

Everybody makes mistakes.

When it happens, there are times when we don't seek forgiveness, but instead, ask for understanding and empathy. That is when we know, we might never be forgiven. For the hurt, the pain, the misery that we inflict on others, due to our mistakes.

Some of us carry this guilt and remorse with us all our lives; others just forget and move on. Whichever we choose, it is important, to remember that at the end of the day, noone is more answerable to our actions than ourselves.

We are, afterall, humans.

GIRL X and GUY Y are both my friends. They are friends as well whom we all met in school. And i happen to be in pretty good terms with the both of them on an individual basis. So today, on MSN, GIRL X: Hey shyuan, i wana ask you about this GUY Y.. my friend's interested in him.. 15mins later, an SMS came in. GUY Y: Hey shyuan, what do you think about GIRL X? Might want to intro her to my friend. Like each other den say la. Shy what shy. -______- Don't let me catch the two of you next time. =P

"In three words I can sum up everything I have learnt about life. It goes on." - Robert Frost There are a few things which I live by in life and one of which is the above-mentioned. Im a pretty firm believer of Fate and that everyone has their place somewhere, somehow. If I have tried and I failed, its probably not meant to be and therefore why try to go against things and make life miserable for myself? In saying so, it does not mean that I do not give my best to whatever I do. Im answerable to myself, not you. Those who matter doesn't judge; those who judge, doesn't matter. Whenever things doesn't go my way, I just pray that time passes faster because I know all the hurt, disappointment, anger, helplessness will soon be gone with time. No doubt there will be a period of time where I will be down and out, I am only human. However, I feel that the more one re-visit the thought about how hurt/angry/helpless they are, the longer they will take to heal. So just let things pass, put that episode behind and look forward instead. I guess I can't have a life long enough for me to keep looking back and think about what-could-have-been. When its over, its over. No point worrying/thinking about things you have no control over. I do not have control over my past, so I look forward more to what-will-be. =)

Today, i spent some time looking through Friendster and Facebook. I realised, People got attached. People got attached to people whom you never thought is possible. People got married. People got married at an age that is probably unimaginable to you. People have jobs. People have jobs that you can only dream of. People have kids. People have kids who are already attending pre-school. People have been to places. People have been to places which you aren't able to anytime soon. People did things. People did things which I probably won't ever get to, ever. And then I thought, What about me? I haven't travelled enough. I haven't got a stable partner. I haven't did things out of the norm, out of my comfort zone. I am barely into my career. What am I doing?

I was trying to recall something just now. Something which I wanted to re-visit. Somehow, I could not remember the details anymore. I decided not to search for it. Since my mind has somehow erased this piece of information, I reckoned it is best left at that. 

Why try to open up old wounds when you have even forgotten where the scar is?

No point. 

*****************************************

Im sure everyone has this experience whereby a certain phrase, action, or even song triggers off memories of a certain person, incident and such. No problems if those memories were pleasant. More often than not, they aren't and thus over the years I have accumulated a personal "To stay away from" list. The listing includes physical actions, verbal phrases, physical objects, songs which I try my very best to steer clear from. The list just gets longer and never seem to shorten.

However, when people supposedly have too much time on their hands, they will purposely re-visit each and every item on that list, and then starts to emo. Like me. 

I hope a day will come when this list is empty. That will be the day when I am able to let go of all emotional baggages and am no longer haunted by unpleasant memories.

I got my results in the midst of our TripleJS KTV session yesterday afternoon. I was screaming so much that I could hardly sing anymore after that. I was quite relieved at my results, you see. Though my CGPA dipped by like 0.06. Boo. 

But still, Im thankful that the worse imaginable for me did not happen. I was expecting a C or even a D for my Literature module. The 50% exam was a 6 choose 4 essay questions paper, and I only completed 2 questions. The other 2 questions which i chose was not even halfway done and it was mere bullshit and more of trying to smoke my prof actually. Hurhh. 

ANYWAYS! Like i said, TripleJS outing yesterday. Lunch at FoodRepublic, KTV at Partyworld, Dinner at Ichiban Sushi, Notice board deco shopping at Daiso and late night Movie at The Cathay. Caught Indiana Jones like finally! Im not too interested in the historical facts and what-nots, but the action interested me nonetheless. Reminds me very much of Nicholas Cage's National Treasure.

After which, the forever-very-kind Santee dropped me off at Zouk where I met up with Chieh and Fish for my 3rd consecutive Wednesday of Mambo madness. 3 weeks with 3 different groups of people. 1st - NIE, 2nd - Hall 12, 3rd - Bestie. No wonder people say i look older than my age. Afterwhich, supper/breakfast at the coffeeshop outside NYJC.

Today's spent at Jamie's place with Harold & Kumar and a round of mahjong. I hu-ed a number of times but in the end i won a dollar only. Haha. Dinner from IKEA restaurant courtesy of Jamie. Transport to and fro courtesy of Selvei. =) H&K was a seriously L-A-M-E show which im glad i did not waste money at the theatres watching it. Selvei had to cover Prisha's eyes every now and then haha. 

Oh, and Selvei's considering enrolling Prisha into St Nicks Primary! Was super excited at the mahjong table upon hearing that. :D Prisha's mandarin is good i tell you, she could understand everything i asked her and even reply me in mandarin. It feels good when you encounter a non-chinese who actually likes and is willing to learn chinese. Even more so for people in my profession.

Next up, i will be meeting Kungfu Panda tomorrow!

Stumbled upon this off the net. Rather interesting. Tell me what you think about it?

Marriage checkist:

1. Is he humble, or does he brag shamelessly or talk about himself constantly?

2. Is he courteous and respectful, or does he repeatedly cut you off in mid-sentence?

3. Does he apologize if he hurts you or has made a mistake?

4. Does he focus on you, or does he seem distracted by other women?

5. Is he patient with children?

6. Does he treat waiters and service people with respect?

7. Does he carry himself in a dignified manner, or does he curse, get drunk, or yell?

8. Does he give to charity?

9. Even if he is not close to his parents or family, does he listen to you when you tell him why he should reconsider?

10. Is he generous, or does he insist you pay half the bill?


If you're dating men who score 7 out of ten on this list, you're doing OK.
